title: Awful receptionists. Incredibly unprofessional!!!
body: Your reception staff are incredibly rude and generally not at all helpful. We were told by 111 we'd speak to a GP however all we got was an obnoxious receptionist speaking to a clinician. They attempted to fob us off and send us to the Bristol Childrens Hospital, despite this not being an emergency. Once we had finally argued our case to see a GP the following day (after turning up at 8am to ensure we got a same day appointment as you can never get through on the phone), we were vindicated by the GP informing us 'The emergency room would not have been appropriate'. We were told to collect a stool sample, handed the tubes by the reception team. However were not informed of sample drop times -' just drop it back to us at the end of the day'. We subsequently missed the collection (we attempted to drop it off at 17:15) and were subsequently told we'd have to take another the next day as collection was at 1645. This was for our 5 month old daughter experiencing gastro issues.

title: Wonderful
body: I cannot thank Ward 12 NSECH for their care and commitment to my dear relative who was admitted on the 23rd December then again on the 6th January, they were brilliant in every aspect, they treat her with such care and compassion, the staff work so hard yet always make time if you have a concern, this ward is run brilliantly, clearly a happy team, thank you Ward 12 you are wondeful

title: Great experience
body:
My experience with croydon talking therapy was very helpful and
beneficial, my therapist was very welcoming, attentive and
was willing to assist me get the help I needed. Overall it was a great
experience, I'm leaving knowing I have a better knowledge about
myself and also, I feel way better than when I started therapy..

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Wonderful experience
body: Recently, I had a knee surgery at Gateway Surgical Center. It was absolutely wonderful experience, I could not believe it. Highly professional atmosphere and great service. My ward had all the necessary equipments, the food was very nice, you definitely won't go hungry. And the view was fantastic. All the staff of the hospital were highly qualified, carrying and very attentive. Especial thank you to the surgen and anesthesiologist (what a pity I cannot mention their names here), they made me feel safe and kept my spirit up during and after surgery. Also very warm thank you to nurses and to a cleaning lady. My best greetings to the surgery. God bless you all.

title: A practice run properly!
body: I registered with Roby after one of my friends recommended them and I am so pleased I took their advice. This is a very well run practice, the staff are helpful and go the extra mile to help you. I was able to phone up in the morning and get a face to face appointment with a GP the same day - something I've not been able to do for years with my old practice. The GP was very caring and took the time to go through everything I needed. I couldn't be more grateful to them and would recommend anyone to register with Roby Medical Centre.

title: Excellent care
body:
Can't fault Chesterfield Royal Hospital, from Emergency Dept right through to Surgical Assessment Unit (Elizabeth ward), and imaging staff,  as soon as I can move about, there'll be flowers and choccies coming your way. 

Big props to the ancillary staff and porters too who are caring above and beyond and wheelchair drivers par excellence, and ct imaging who despite being very busy, were compassionate, human, and professional at all times.  Plenty of masks and hand gel everywhere, such a shame so many visitors think they're above using them or socially distancing from poorly patients.
Cannot praise the staff of this hospital highly enough.

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Recommendations
body:
Homeless recovery,
Head injuries,
Emotional discord,
Health and well being,
Care,
Self esteem building,
Compassion,
Bereavement,
Hope and support.

From my experience whilst a patient here I recognise great potential including all above for Salvation and encouragement in one's life and recovery to well being.

Great Staff, catering for all food lovers with great taste and fulfillment.

Patient staff and games room with arts and craft.

It's a joy to be around pleasant people. From one's ups and downs in life you are well found here...

Thank You God for Goodmayes Hospital.

X

title: Brilliant care
body: My Dad has recently been nursed on Glynde Ward - the team were truly amazing and everyone treated both my Dad and his family with care and dignity at all times - they were brilliant

title: Our story of an exemplary service
body:
We arrived at A&E on 26 November early afternoon and were greeted by 2 friendly staff. We had sustained a fall with suspected fractures to upper limbs. We were booked in at reception and seen in a short period of time by the triage Dr and the X-ray department. Upon arriving back at A&E we were immediately directed to the relevant specialists to be given the result of our injuries. My husband sustained a fractured shoulder and was seen by the Dr again and issued with a collar and cuff, pain medication and a telephone appointment scheduled later in the week with the consultant. I saw a specialist nurse for my injuries. The nurse was kind, empathetic and explained how I could manage my  injuries and pain relief. We did not have to wait long to be seen from the time we arrived to going home. It all went smoothly and was very well coordinated.
We were then discharged home with follow up letters sent to our home and our GP practice and telephone calls followed from the consultant and physiotherapy service as scheduled.
 We have both made a very good recovery and feel we have been cared for very well.

From  walking into A &E the care we have received by the staff has been exemplary and the service seamless from one department to another including all the staff who have attended to us along our recovery journey. We cannot thank the team who saw to us on the afternoon of 26th November ie the receptionists , Dr, Nurse and X-ray staff were brilliant including the follow  up care by the Consultant and physiotherapy team. I am only sorry we cannot name all the staff who were on duty that day  to give them our heartfelt thanks but I hope this review reaches them.
Thank you once again.

readBy.name: James Paget University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: I have had the misfortune since Xmas to need to call 3 times and every time I have called ( have had to wait a little while each morning between 5-15 mins but this is to be expected) the receptionists have been helpful and considerate ( I always explain my symptoms) . Each time this has resulted in an appt and the drs I have seen have been lovely ( one at each surgery as Earls Bart), patient and informative. I would recommend this practice. I have been a patient here for 25 years

title: Efficient and caring
body: I cannot praise A and E enough.   My Mum was admitted by ambulance seen immediately by lovely caring staff.   Consultant saw me straight away.   Scan done within an hour and results phoned through to me by co sultans an hour later.

title: A practice that cares
body: As a patient for only 5 years this is by far and excellent practice. The doctors, nurses and staff are amazing , they answer the phones and do their best to get you seen or referred to the correct department of service. I have felt much more at ease with my Heath and confident with the information provided with regards to Heath issues and queries. The trust they install and do their uttermost for their patients. Thank you

title: Great practice
body: Reception staff and doctors have gone above and beyond to help my husband Rodney Poole this week a massive thank you to all the staff at cliff surgery for your help and support

title: Great surgery
body: Have been seen a couple of times this month. Calls were returned to me, and even reception phoned me back. I noticed a big turn around at kingwood and more patients inside surgery. I  Think Kingwood is turning things around. Hallelujah

title: Poor service
body: Since moving to a far more wealthier suburb of Leicester Forest East than Forest House that catered for far poorer patients of Braunstone, the level of patient service and support for the poorer patients has become non existent. I appreciate that the practices new and wealthy patients can afford the extra expense of Blood pressure machines, etc. for the poorer patients of Braunstone, still on their books these are unaffordable and beyond their finances especially in this time of cost of living crisis. Being told by a doctor that blood pressure results need to be taken twice a day (outside of surgery hours) for seven days, and be advised by reception you will have to buy a blood pressure machine, this is totally unacceptable. Most practises offer blood pressure machines to be borrowed, signed for and returned. If Warren Lane surgery only want financially lucrative patients they should advise their poorer Braunstone patients and help them change to a more sympathetic surgery.

title: Manvers Ward and Portland Ward
body:
My dad has just been discharges  having sent 3 weeks in hospital.  Most of the time on Manvers ward.  I would just like to say thank you so much for the wonderful care keith received.  Its been outstanding.  Staff have been exceptionally kind, caring and have kept me informed of dads condition everyday. Which as a concerned daughter i really did appreciate.  From the cleaners up
 to the consultants i have upmost respect for their professional behaviour and kind manners.  The nurse practitioner on Manvers ward was  a true professional and a lovely lady.  I do hope this feed back is passed onto the relevant wards.  An ever grateful daughter

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very Rude Reception Staff
body: Although the Doctors themselves seem pretty good, the practice is basically ruined by the very rude lady on reception. Curtsey costs nothing.

author: lovetp84
title: Physiotherapy after breaking my leg
body: Went there for physiotherapy a couple of times and treatment was brilliant. I had a broken leg and the exercises and sessions really helped. It was rather a long time though from leaving the hospital to actually getting the physiotherapy appointments – maybe they could be more regular too. Am grateful though for what they have done for me.

author: Andor
title: Very grateful for the excellent care
body: I’ve been attending the Glasgow Hair clinic for many years, and thought I should highlight the excellent service and lovely team. I accidentally went to the wrong venue yesterday, but was fitted in to the clinic in the correct venue later in the morning. Dr Graham was thorough, listened and had a lovely manner. I’ve had the same experience in the past with Dr Holmes too. I’ve never felt rushed or dismissed, and I’m very grateful for the excellent care I’ve received.

author: travellered68
title: The nurses were brilliant
body: The nurses were brilliant, made me feel welcome and calm while also being very informative and making sure I got the most out the visit

author: Hope66
title: They were interested, attentive and friendly
body:
I accompanied my sister to her appointment with Dr Brodie at Coathill Hospital Coatbridge.  
The Doctor and her team were so helpful and supportive of my sister’s needs. Although she can’t communicate very well, they were patient with her and were respectful, ensuring that they spoke directly with her and checking her level of discomfort.  
They were interested, attentive and friendly, putting us both at ease. Most importantly they were extremely competent at their jobs!

author: Joy03
title: I can't praise them enough
body:
I went in for a colonoscopy and was feeling really nervous and also scared. From the moment I arrived the nurse in charge of me was amazing. She went through the paperwork and I didn't feel rushed. She gave me some tips to use during the process and helped allay my fears.  
Once I went through to the room where the process was to take place the two nurses and the doctor were friendly and put me at my ease. Afterwards the first nurse was there to help again and at no time did I feel abandoned. They also make the best tea and toast in the world.  
I can't praise them enough. If I need to have this procedure again I know I'll be in good hands.

author: T73
title: Thank you for being quick and effective
body: I attended for repeat pills for my contraception. All the staff were welcoming and kind! The nurse was lovely and very kind and caring. Thank you, Anna, for being quick and effective at re-issuing my pills.

author: Rikqs54
title: Help with wheelchair access
body: Advocacy has much helped with my wheelchair access, thank you

author: Rikqs54
title: Advocacy input
body: The food has improved, thank you for the advocacy input.

author: An other
title: The service I received was incredible
body:
I gave birth to twins via c-section at the Ulster Hospital - this was baby number 3 and 4 for me. I had successfully breast fed my older two children but twins was much more challenging. I received support from Tricia when I was in hospital for the first week. She was absolutely incredible and I don't know how I would have managed that first week without her. She made sure I was sent home with a hospital pump and I would have been lost without this. Tricia put me in contact with Jenni when we left hospital.  
When we were discharged we received support from Jenni in hospital and over the phone when I needed her. I breast fed the twins for 4.5 months and believe I never would have been able to do this without Jenni's support. She was always there on phone/text/in person when I needed her. She put together feeding plans for both twins who struggled gaining at different times. She supported me with breastfeeding tips and when to feed/pump/top-up with expressed milk or formula.  
I was so exhausted and overwhelmed at times and having the support from Jenni really helped me. We have history of milk allergy in our family and Jenni was able to put a plan together for the twins, topping up with hydrolysed formula and only attempting the milk ladder when we were sure the twins were able to handle it.  
We are still working our way through the milk ladder and up until our recent discharge, Jenni was there to answer any query I had- even if it was just a quick text. One of the twins really struggled to gain weight at the start, dropping to the 0.2 centile. He is now thriving at the 75th for his weight. Without support from Jenni for him, I believe I would have stopped breastfeeding much sooner than I did and he would have had many more admissions to hospital for his weight loss.  
The service I received from Jenni was incredible. She is a valuable asset for any Mum struggling with breast feeding/weight gain/feeding multiples. I am so grateful we were referred to her for support.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: CearG21
title: They looked after me so well
body: I just want to thank the wonderful service I received last Friday at Lagan Valley Hospital in Lisburn NI. The excellent phone first and then the care and compassion from Audrey APN, Emma the radiographer and Roisin. Despite a fractured knee, they looked after me so well.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Anonn1
title: Booking appointment for my child
body:
As instructed, I tried to complete the form for my child who has a tummy problem, after completing the form it refuses to complete, instead I have the -We can't safely assess your symptoms through this online request. You need to talk to someone today instead.  
I phoned and was on hold, position number 9.

author: marszf74
title: Mental health team total lack of response
body:
I have ASPD, Psychosis, Depression, Anxiety, I see and hear things and have a really impulsive nature, which has landed me in maximum security hospitals and medium security for multiple years at a time.  
I decided a few weeks ago that rather than going down the same path as I usually do, I would ask for help. Now I do not tell anyone about my thoughts but for the last 2 weeks I have really tried. Only one of the duty team actually listened to me and all the rest cut me off, saying sorry and they don't have my records, they couldn't deal with me.  
Now they are trying to do things I do not need or want. One nurse's response was that they had no time to listen to me as it was a waste of funds. I would of thought a 20 minute conversation was a lot cheaper than a 2 year minimum stay in a high security hospital. Another told me as, because I was impulsive, medication or admission were my only options. Again very expensive and wasted.

author: helenj79
title: Unable to get an appointment
body:
Frustrated and disappointed. I have had a repeat prescription for some time, I go to renew it as normal and it is not listed thus I have to contact GP for review, therefore I am not able to get it renewed until I have a doctors appointment.  
Noting my medication is due to run out, and aware I must make an appointment on the day, I phone at 8.30 am the next day when appointment line opens. 143 attempts to get through from me as my husband calls to try on his phone and gets through on 109th attempt.  
It is 9.10 am by this point and no appointments left as I am told by an automated message. That was Monday. I have tried each day this week, during time I am meant to be working, each time getting through around 9.06 to 9.10 am with no appointments left.  
Today my exasperation and upset is worse as I get through on my 82nd call at 8.50 am (twenty minutes after appointment line opened)…to no appointments left! Surely this is not acceptable - especially when medication I am on is for anxiety. I am not an emergency case, I do appreciate this, but getting an appointment to renew is all I ask.  
My husband went in to surgery and asked to make an appointment on my behalf, even pre-bookable. The reply was that I need to phone in. I had complained last year when experiencing similar issues and was told due to covid there was a lack of GPs and appointments due to it.  
It saddens me, as they have been so helpful in the past and the GP has been very understanding and helpful in the past.

author: likeablehd54
title: Abrupt call handler
body: The person who received my call an hour ago was not nice, very abrupt. I felt unhappy as they must be compassionate with people needing care.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Worried Spouse
title: Medical Assessment Unit Royal Gwent
body:
Referred by GP for fluid around heart and atrial fibrillation.  
We arrived at 10am and were Covid tested and returned to MAU by 10.30. It was horrific, my husband was expected to eat, drink and sleep in the waiting room. He was there for 33 hrs before he was given a trolley in the ward area.  
We were advised he was and still is at serious risk of stroke yet he remained in waiting area. He was taken into cubicle for treatment and then returned to waiting area which was exceedingly busy.  
It was only when I spoke to nursing staff and said I would be making a complaint that they found a trolley. He had no access to bathing and showering facility.  
Nursing staff were good but communication was poor.

author: Niamhh1
title: Couldn't be better
body:
I came from Craigavon to Lurgan 4 days ago. The food is fine. All the nurses are so wonderful.  
My side room is very clean, always kept very clean. Honestly could not think of anything I would want the nurses to do differently or something I wish could have been better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: AMU Has been pretty decent
body:
AMU has been pretty decent so far like I haven't had an issue so not really gonna complain about the care that I have been getting since admission.  
The only problem is at times it's a bit loud but there's not much that can be done there. The food's good though as is the cleaning you know everything is kept well on the ward.  
The staff really do a great job though i understand them just fine and really and I appreciate what they do.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: MBT123
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Thank you for this therapy journey
body:
The MBT group therapy has opened my mind to understanding my own thoughts and feelings and other people's (in the group & external). I feel like the awareness of mentalizing in the group setting has followed me into my daily life.  
What was helpful/unhelpful -  
Routine sessions were helpful to build up trust and relationships.  
More people at the beginning may have been helpful but understandable in the circumstances (i.e., COVID).  
Experiences of facilitators -  
They were helpful, supportive and compassionate. I feel heard and respected as an individual. They have opened my mind to other opinions/others mindsets.  
Thank you for this therapy journey. I was uncertain how it would help me at first but it has definitely improved my life.

author: Friend of hospital
title: Very caring and professional
body:
I was admitted to hospital on the daycare ward for a hysteroscopy polypectomy and endometrial biopsy after being seen as an outpatient at Pilgrim Hospital.  
All the staff in that department were kind and caring. All nursing, doctors and recovery staff explained everything to me about my procedure and aftercare in easily understood dialogue  
After my procedure I was very well cared for until I was allowed to go home.  
I was given advice on aftercare and numbers to contact if needed.  
Although I was nervous I couldn't fault my care and would like to thank everyone who cared for me.  
Pilgrim Hospital were very caring and professional. The hospital was spotlessly clean.

author: Beth206
title: Empathy, understanding and skill
body:
I was diagnosed with Ramsay Hunt Syndrome in 2017 which left me with paralysis down the left side of my face. The nerves regrew several months later, however I've been left with Synkinesis which affects my mental and physical wellbeing.  
I was recently referred to Miss Dhillon by my GP. She has shown great empathy, understanding and skill in treating me and has been a real encouragement. She took a lot of time to listen to my concerns and discomfort and has gone to great lengths to think of different treatments to improve my condition, which I very much appreciate. Her support and kindness has been invaluable.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Russell16
title: We had a really good laugh and the job got done!
body: I arrived 20 minutes early for my appointment and was seen nicely early. The lady who was charged with taking photographs of my eyes had her work cut out - it soon became apparent that I found it nearly impossible to let anything come near to my eyes. Despite my bravest efforts I found it almost impossible to keep my eyes open as instructed. My torturer was fantastic, putting me at my ease with good natured encouragement and easy humour. Despite my discomfort, we had a really good laugh and the job got done! I wish I had taken in her name as she was the perfect person to undertake the work. Big thanks!

author: grateful78
title: All the staff were incredibly friendly and kind
body: I was admitted to ward 32 for a hysterectomy this week. All went well with the procedure and I was well cared for on the ward. All the staff were incredibly friendly and kind and made sure that pain relief was on hand and that I had plenty of cups of coffee! Particular thanks to the night nurse who cared for me both nights I was in, her gentle and reassuring manner was greatly appreciated.

readBy.name: Office of Jenni Minto, MSP for Argyll and Bute

author: JHEST
title: Treatment for Macular Degeneration
body:
The staff in this department at Goole are always professional, but also very friendly.  
Everything is done to make sure the patient knows what is happening, and is happy.  
I cannot praise them enough for making me feel so secure when having eye examinations and injections.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

author: asteropekt57
title: Amazing staff made me feel safe & very looked after
body:
I was admitted to L4 after an emergency operation & I really can’t praise the care I received high enough.  
The staff are so busy & do long shifts, but nothing was too much trouble - I spent 18 days on the ward.  
The nursing staff are truly amazing, made me feel safe & very looked after .

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: The big one
title: I couldn’t fault my treatment
body:
I phoned ward 206, Transplants, not feeling too great on arrival I was met by the staff and very soon after I had a full set of observations done which showed I was running a temperature and a high pulse, so classic signs of infection, that was closely followed by a full set of bloods and blood cultures.  
Then I was shown to my bed space, which was very clean. No sooner there and I had a jug of water and a glass .Once the lab had run my blood I was seen by the on-call reg, who confirmed I had high infection numbers shortly after the night shift nurse put my first bag of IV antibiotics up.  
In the morning the day staff were all very nice and soon breakfast was round the wards, followed by the tea trolley with a smiling face delivered me my coffee and asked me if I missed the place that much I had to come back so soon.  
But from the porters right through to the surgical team I couldn’t fault my treatment . Also the students on placement always had a word and asking if the could get me anything . Discharge was also fast and effective.

author: songthrushew99
title: Felt safe for contraceptive implant
body:
The staff were welcoming, though did dismiss my friend who came with me.  
Also heard other staff talking badly about 17 year olds receiving the implant, but the staff looking after me were amazing. They explained the whole process to me and made me feel incredibly comfortable and safe.

author: importerpm65
title: Couldn’t praise the staff and treatment highly enough
body: I attended ED at Causeway Hospital with my nephew who had scalded his hand. We were directed straight to the green zone and following some speedy assessment questions to his dad he was treated by the nurse practitioner. Treatment took about an hour as it takes time for the cooling gel pad to work. Staff were excellent in supporting him, especially as he has a learning difficulty and was very scared of attending the hospital. I couldn’t praise the staff and treatment highly enough and would like to thank all involved.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ila13
title: Everyone was absolutely amazing
body:
Bunion operation.  
I would like to say a BIG THANK YOU for all person from open the door to close after everything. All member of this shift on this day was absolutely amazing.  
I'm very grateful to lovely nurse, doctors, physiotherapist... so much professional, caring, friendly. I feel taken care of - from head to toe.  
It's very helpful. Thank you very much ❤

title: From the entrance door until the head office
body:
Great practice and professionally 
I am looking for one of my company client in the hospital and I am pleased to seeing how amazing professionals working here. I'm glad to see it and in the same way that the patient and relatives come in exposed the bad experience I am coming to exposed the good experience in the Ashford and St Peter's Hospitals NHS hospital and said Thankful for all your supportive environment.

author: Falkirk Patient
title: Cannot thank everyone concerned enough
body:
A 6cm Ovarian cyst was incidentally discovered during a urology investigation. I am so grateful to the radiologist at Forth Valley Royal for making the observation and investigating further via internal ultrasound at the time. She was both kind and efficient, and I wish I could recall her name to thank her.  
At my time of life there's a higher risk that such growth could be cancerous and I was relieved at how fast referral and action happened.  
I was also tremendously scared.  
The pre-op nurse Sharen was friendly, efficient and reassuring during my pre-op check, and a date for surgery came through quickly.  
Unfortunately, I then developed a very troublesome cough which kept waking me in the night and put me in a bit of a panic about the operation and recovery so I phoned for advice. Pre-op nurse Trudy spoke kindly to me and also took the time to confer with the anaesthetist, before coming back to me straight away with advice to postpone. I was both grateful and even more scared in case the delay led to more harm. Fortunately , however, they were able to reschedule me just a couple of weeks later.  
I attended FVR Ambulatory Care for day surgery, with an expected overnight stay. All staff encountered were friendly and efficient, which really helped as I was very frightened. The nurse who checked me in, both surgeons Consultant Sarah and Vicky, and Owen the anaesthetist, were friendly, informative, caring and efficient, as was the theatre technician assisting with my preparation. I am so grateful to them all.  
Surgery went well and I was then transferred to the Women and Children's Department for overnight care. I needed nasal oxygen, and a full mask overnight due to low oxygen but the friendly and efficient nursing staff helped me cope with this. Pain management was excellent too. Night staff were on call a lot that night, another patient close by was very sick, and it was obviously a tough shift but they were all exemplary in attitude and care. Aside from the outstanding care of all the medical staff I'd like to put in a good word for the FVR catering staff too. The server was friendly, the menu decent, and the food simple, good, and hot. First class both main meals.  
I was told that I could leave once my baseline oxygen reached a reliable 94/95 without assistance, I could empty my bladder, and was mobile. This was achieved by afternoon and I was home by tea time.  
I am now one night home and in recovery, and cannot thank everyone concerned enough. I wish I could recall all their names because they were all deeply appreciated. Fingers crossed for a smooth recovery and huge thanks to all at Forth Valley.

title: Thank you again RBH and NHS
body:
I attended for endometrial ablation. As always, overall I was impressed with my experience. There was one part which was not as I would expect it to be (topic of conversation during the type of procedure), however I fed back via PALS and received the best response within 1.5 hours. It’s true that it is how feedback is taken and responded to that can influence how you feel and I’m relieved no other woman will experience this in the future due to the learning. Thank you for this service which allows medical staff to focus on patients. 

There are some wonderful people in this hospital who commit to their roles well. Again, on calling the department to find out if it was the post impacting my biopsy result, I was immediately informed honestly of the situation. In the same call, I indicated my treatment preference and within 6 days an appointment letter arrived. This is exceptional. 

The appointment was to time and I liked the guidance to get my post procedure prescription whilst waiting for the pre meds to take affect. I was surprised at the free prescription- what a refreshing change! The advice from the consultant on when to take the tablets was helpful, meaning I avoided unnecessary pain. The consultant was excellent. The nurses were attentive. I appreciated the consultant observer taking time to thank me for allowing him to see a treatment he may introduce to his setting- this I found very respectful. The room was well prepared. Thank you to all concerned. 

Please could the hospital consider needing to wear face coverings during surgical procedures - with all precautions in place and being outside of a pandemic, I do think that a patient should be able to breathe freely. There is some pain/ discomfort and risk of nausea and deep air breathing helps.

title: PALS great service
body:
I wished to praise the excellent responsiveness of PALs. I did not wish to complain, instead just sharing feedback. It was something I reflected on and sought trusted view on that I was not overreacting. PALS’ response was speedy. This is so reassuring and eases any further stress or anxiety. An excellent service, that must minimise stress to medical staff also. I received an excellent response from a lead within an hour and a half. I could not have asked for more. I think I’m responsive in my work role but this has made me think further on how language can really impact how a person raising a concern can feel dependent on response. 
Thank you for this excellent and essential service.

author: marsnq64
title: Better communication needed
body:
Think the communication about how long it was going to take to get radiotherapy treatment could have been better. I was concerned whether longer than 12 weeks after surgery was ok from a clinical perspective.  
Left phone messages as instructed on my CT planning letter, got no reply and so had to revert to calling breast care nurses who were ably to allay my worries.  
Once I got to radiotherapy treatment, it was much more difficult than I had envisaged to get in to a comfortable position to stay still. Think a couple of deep in and out breaths, like at a pilates class when you first lay down on the mat, would get you in to a better position.  
During treatment I had quite a few questions about exactly what was happening when, which the radiographers were good at explaining.

title: Great Nurses
body: The other evening I has to bring my father from one hospital to the MRI to see vascular experts. He was quickly taken under the care of the excellent vascular registrar and another doctor. They were fantastic. He was admitted but whilst awaiting a bed becoming free was cared for by a fantastic nurse called Elouise. Brilliant care for My dad. Made me feel He was in great hands. Thank you

author: Aquarius6
title: It felt good to get it off my chest and finally be understood- I felt safe.
body: It first happened nearly two years ago when I had my first panic attack, but it spiralled more out of control last October when I had a fight with my sister. I admitted that I wanted to die and had suicidal thoughts, it was that serious I had to go to the GP where I was scared that they wouldn’t believe me about my anxiety- I was then referred to CAMHS the next week. Going to CAMHS I was so anxious and nervous to tell them my story, but once I did it felt good to get it off my chest and finally be understood- I felt safe.

title: Went for vasectomy
body: Was very nervous about the procedure but the staff couldn’t have been any more professional, helpful and friendly. They all put me at ease and kept me like that throughout.

author: Dee100
title: Kind and thoughtful care for son's wrist fracture
body:
My son sustained a serious wrist fracture that needed surgery.  
The staff and surgeon were amazing at Belfast Children's Hospital. They constantly had to work against lack of beds and theatre space. My son had to wait days before the surgeon could operate due to the lack of allocated list.  
Staff were so thoughtful and kind throughout the difficult time. The surgeon was amazing, very approachable and easy to talk to, and explained things in a way that was easy to understand. We didn't feel rushed or made to feel unimportant that has happened on the past with other consultants.  
She showed she genuinely cared and was equally frustrated about the lack of theatre availability. My son wasn't the only child, there were four kids who had to come back daily to see if they could get theatre space.  
Fracture clinic staff in the children's hospital are amazing. They can't do enough when you're there and always squeeze you in if something has gone a bit wrong with a child's cast.  
Bit of a nightmare trying to get through from switchboard as they seem to often transfer you to a phone that just rings out when you ask to be put through to the children's fracture clinic. So they usually then try a second number where you get through straight to the clinic.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Professional and friendly Reception Staff
body: Being the first point of contact for patients the reception staff must be under a lot of pressure, handling many calls.  My experience was friendly, efficient and reassuring. I was able to send photos/details via a link that was shown to the doctor after which I received a call back from the receptionist with feedback and helpful instructions.  Anything that takes the pressure off a very busy surgery - and the knowledgeable reception staff are an amazing conduit between supporting patients and doctors.

title: Fantastic throughout
body:
I cannot recommend SpaMedia in Edge Lane, highly enough.  All of the staff are professional, friendly and really helpful.

The service I have received and the treatment on my cataracts is first class.  I have been given my life back and I cannot thank everyone enough.

Thank you SpaMedica

title: Great experience
body: After a year of calf pain , i attended an appointment with a  physiotherapist, after questions and examination i was put on an exercise plan and within 3 weeks the pain has gone . Thank you so much for your help , really appreciated . Great hospital

title: efficient and responsive service
body: I have just had a very good experience with one of the nurses.  The nurse was both professional and skilful and also put me at my ease during the procedure.  I have found the practice to be very responsive and I have never felt that I can't speak to anyone.  I have found all staff to be highly professional and respectful

author: Jacs17
title: I could not fault the team that looked after me
body:
I was in for a lumpectomy and lymph node removal. I was a day case. I was admitted into Pilgrim Hospital at 7:30am for this procedure and I was seen by everyone quickly and by 4 pm I was well enough to be able to go home.  
The nursing care was good with lots of caring nurses, the anaesthetists stuck in my mind as they were absolutely fantastic! All the procedures were explained fully and with so much care. I was able to ask any questions and they happily answered these to my full satisfaction.  
I felt like a special person due to their care and support. They made me feel like royalty! I could not fault the team that looked after me.

author: Farang
title: My baby development
body: My baby girl health visitor is brilliant, she always supports me and I am really proud of her.

title: Great people
body: After living in many areas of London for years, I can only say that this practice is how the others ones should be. From the moment you talk to the receptionist to arrange an appointment to the actual visit, the people of this practice just seem to their job well. Since I need to take an injection  every so often, my experience has always been brilliant, from the receptionists, the kind and professional nurses to the doctors updating my records, I can only say thank you.

author: clive2449
title: First class care for tongue biopsy
body:
Well as usual with our wonderful NHS, I received 1st class treatment from Nigel, Seraphina & Julie.  
I wasn't nervous anyway but they put me in an even more relaxed position. Many thanks.

author: Debbie69
title: What a great service!
body:
My mum was in hospital at the start of the year with a bad chest infection. This affected her mobility from lying in bed. When she was discharged, the team that came to her house were fantastic .  
A special mention from her and a big thank you to Carol and Rhona for their fantastic services.  
Thank you from the family also ! What a great service!

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Great Practice
body: The team at Yetminster Health Centre are always very kind, friendly and caring in a professional manner. We cannot recommend them highly enough. We feel very lucky to have such a good service from the NHS.   Thank you!

author: irregularityxg69
title: A game changer
body:
I received excellent advice on how to facilitate my body to recover. Before my appointments I was beginning to despair and didn't think I'd ever get better. Now I know I can. The plan I was given and also the explanation as to why was a game changer.  
I feel confident that if I carry on the exercises I'll improve daily.  
Thank you.

author: orangeme33
title: Recommend service to anyone
body:
I have had a very good experience with the team. I have done 3 courses and became a volunteer mentor and am now helping others.  
I enjoyed all work with the team and all staff were brilliant all a while my experience was great and I would recommend it to anyone

author: Grayg69
title: Care and compassion
body:
I was seen and treated in West Cornwall Urgent Treatment Centre today following a minor injury .  
The care I received was excellent. Thank you very much Sharon ,Colin,Kim ,Jack and Emma .

title: Difficulty with appointments
body:
I tried to book an appointment today at 9.50 am to be told no appointments available and the only way of booking was to ring at 8am the next day. I had already given details of why I needed to see the doctor which was of a private nature. 
I take my Grandson to his school leaving my house at 7.30 and arriving home about 9am How am I supposed to make an appointment? 
It feels to me a poor service.

title: Fantastic practice
body: I’ve been seen twice at the practice and both times it has been very professional and uncomplicated. The staff at the front, along with the doctors and nurses are all friendly and helpful. Could not recommend the practice anymore - great job!

title: Excellent reception desk
body: Rang this morning at 8 am and after a few minutes wait, spoke to a receptionist who was very polite, friendly and professional. I was impressed with the manner in which she dealt with my query as she was very helpful and demonstrated excellent customer care skills. I was offered an appointment for this afternoon for which I was grateful.

author: Dragonfly42
title: I really appreciate the communication
body:
Since the start of my prostate problem/issues some 2.5 years ago I have been amazed at the level of communication from the hospital personnel who have been monitoring my condition.  
Whilst the "news" is not always good news I really appreciate the communication keeping me abreast of my condition.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Troggy
title: In good hands at the eye clinic
body:
I recently visited the eye clinic for an ongoing check up.  
I was treated very well and made to feel at ease from Christine through to the doctor. The wait time has improved considerably, so well done.  
I will be attending many more appointments and know I will be in good hands. Thank you.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Everything with the staff has been fine
body:
I was transferred hospital from the Royal Victoria Hospital in Belfast to Craigavon Hospital two weeks ago after I received surgery in Belfast.  
My GP was in contact with the staff in Craigavon and then I was transferred over. I received a bed quite quickly. Craigavon hospital has some great facilities, and the 1 South ward is well kept, everything's clean.  
Everything with the staff has been fine the communication is okay. The physiotherapist has been brilliant, they have been coming to the ward to see me and have been helping me get back on my feet. I have seen major improvements already, their help is greatly appreciated.  
The food on the ward has been okay, it has been better than the first hospital that I was in.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Excellent care
body:
I have been on the One South ward for three weeks now. I'm very happy with the care I have been receiving, it has been great.  
The staff all work extremely hard, they never get a minute, the ward is always busy.  
I don't mind being placed in an extra bed on the ward as it's not the nurses' fault, I still feel as if I get enough privacy and the facilities are all close by and accessible.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I cannot complain about the care I have been receiving
body:
I arrived to the hospital in an ambulance, after a long wait in the emergency department I was finally transferred to a ward.  
1 South has been perfect, the staff are all lovely and helpful and I cannot complain about the care I have been receiving, its 10/10.  
The food has been nice enough, the meals keep me full and they are a good size.  
The cleanliness of the ward is really good, the facilities have been kept spotless this past week .

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great experience!!!
body:
Your Review:  I attended the surgery this morning.
I left home early and reached the surgery early for my appointment.
Upon arrival the lady at the reception saw my condition and offered immediate help. She called the manager upstairs to kindly ask if the dr can see me earlier.
I was seen after 5 mins. Dr a.m called the ambulance immediately as I was in a very bad state and was even spitting blood. The practice manager was very kindly sitting in the room with me until paramedics have arrived. Very grateful. Caring people.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Brilliant communication
body: The nursing staff on 3 South have been looking after me this past week, I'm very thankful for the care they have provided me with, there has been no issues. The communication with staff is also brilliant, I'm regularly updated and the staff are all easy to talk to if you have any questions. The ward facilities are great and the rooms are laid out good, I have a lot of space and feel really comfortable in a room of my own.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rockpool
title: All staff I met were professional & personable
body: First class service at the Gartnavel Endoscopy Unit. A very efficient process with clear explanations along the way. All staff I met were professional & personable.

title: Exceedingly pleased today
body:
Got up early to get an appointment, could not log into my usual NHS site, but accessed it via Patient Access and within a couple of minutes, had obtained an appointment.  
Saw the GP, who asked numerous questions until she understood my history; cross-checked it with me, relayed her understanding back, whilst she made notes on her computer.  Arranged a hospital bone density check; changed my medication; notifying my pharmacy immediately.  Also asked me to suspend one medication, until she received the result of the hospital test. 
Advised me to keep a record of my blood pressure and a diary of all the Foods and drink I consume, and recommended changes to my Dairy diet. 
Finally made another appointment for me to see her in Two weeks time. 

I immediately went to my pharmacy, who had just received her notification of my change in medication, and collected it.  
All in all, a superb visit, better than expected.

author: patcx84
title: Recent appointment
body: No one called at the allocated time, for an appointment I have had to wait weeks for. Very disappointed as it is to do with my medication, and need a review.

author: CheekyToddler
title: Really good with my 4 year old
body: Sarah in cardio respiratory was really good with my 4 year old who has special needs when he had an ecg yesterday.

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ellen 89
title: Amazing support from staff
body: My daughter was admitted to Neely Ward after a lengthy wait in ED. She was very sore, anxious and nervous about staying on her own. The staff looking after her were made aware of her anxieties and were just amazing supporting her through a stressful time -special mention to Carolyn, Pauline, Simone, Janine and all the staff on the ward who went out of their way to make her feel so well looked after and understood. Everyone had a smile on their face and took time to explain everything to her, despite the very busy ward environment and workload they had. Thank you to all in Neely Ward. NHS heroes x

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great service
body: Left my “Blood pressure “ tablets in France , messaged the practice the day I returned, and within hours they had re issued me my prescription, fast and efficient service very happy customer/ patient 😀👍

author: importersh89
title: A virtual visit with my mother
body:
My 91yr mother was admitted to hospital on Wed with an extremely high heart rate and very breathless. I live a two hour drive from Daisy Hill hospital and unable to visit everyday. I was so grateful to be able to see and talk with my mother today using the virtual visit service.  
It's a fantastic service -my mother has temporarily lost her sight so is unable to use her phone so this service is perfect for her as someone sets it up for her and although she can't see me, she can hear and talk with me. Its such a relief to me that I can see how she is too. Also my son was able to join us and he lives in England which my mother really enjoyed.  
Thank you so much for organising this service it really is brilliant.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Grateful from Glasgow
title: Wonderfully caring and compassionate staff
body: My husband had knee replacement surgery at Stobhill Day Hospital, the care provided from admission to discharge was superb. Grateful thanks to all, especially to staff in ward A who supported him through post surgical complications. The aftercare post discharge was great too. We are so grateful to the wonderfully caring and compassionate staff in Stobhill and we are so lucky to have our NHS.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

title: GPS great management/admin not
body: Unfortunately getting an appointment here is very unlikely even if you wait at the phone at 8am. I find the staff there (except GPS) very unhelpful. Very unprofessional gossiping at desk whilst you're in waiting room. Ignore or keep people on hold while they have a chat. It's just not good professional practice

title: Unacceptable waiting time and patients not…
body:
19 02 2023 I was recommended by 111 to take my 75 year old wife who was feeling very unwell to the centre suffering with very erratic blood pressure and heart rhythm. 

On arrival, the notice on the entrance door advised that the wearing of masks was mandatory, which we complied with. 

There was no one on reception initially and standing was difficult for my wife. Eventually we were called forward to be informed that there was a 5 hour wait. There is no way, with my wife feeling as poorly as she was that she could have endured that ordeal. She needed to be laying down. 

My observations are :-

The wait time was totally unacceptable. 

The staff’s management of the crowded waiting area was totally inadequate in that the vast majority of patients and there carers were not wearing masks. 

On leaving the building it was noticed that the surrounding paving was littered with empty cans and discarded masks. Probably because the only waste bin was rammed full of rubbish. 

On reflection our visit was a total waste of time and, in hindsight, we should probably have gone to A & E. 

I would not recommend this facility to anyone.

title: Very bad experience
body: The Reception staff is very rude and unprofessional. Just increases patient stress level. Not willing to listen but quick to respond. Same is their It staff who helps with registration.

title: Disgusting service
body: I rand the surgery 87 times (redial)last friday then waited 30 mins to speak to a human only to be told no appointments I have a chest infection been ill for 3 wks I m bringing up green phlegm with blood in it the receptionist was rude and uncaring she told me to go to a pharmacy which I did to be told I can see and hear you need antibiotics there is nothing we can do you need to see a dr!  in my opinion they are fed up with drs sending patients to them ! The receptionist Also told me to go to a minor injuries dept in Glastonbury or chard !! It was all I could do to to go to a pharmacy I certainly couldn’t drive there and here I am Monday still ill about to ring again I hold out no hope though …… absolutely terrible service

title: Wonderful service
body: I have visited the West Hull Health Hub Calvert Lane several times this year for consultations and treatment. The nurses and reception staff are professional, kind and understanding. In particular I would like to thank the GP who has seen me.The GP is absolutely wonderful and I am so grateful for the help which I have been given.

title: Normally good practice
body: However, during my most recent visit I waited 45 min, which is not normally the case, when the nurse came she told me the system had crashed and I needed to rebook another appointment.  She apologised and took my details saying I would be contacted. Its been 5 days and no contact has been made.

title: Vasectomy
body:
I was initially quite worried about the procedure. The staff made me feel at ease as soon as I arrived, the doctor explained everything to me and simplified it to make it easier to digest. The two nurses who were present were fantastic, I can not speak highly enough about the staff, true professionals who made the whole process a breeze. All in all I was in there about 30 minutes and really shouldn’t have worried, there was no need to, I was in safe hands the moment I walked in. Hats off to the doctor and two nurses you were all fantastic. Communication before hand was second to none aswell. 
Thankyou

title: Superb Endoscopy
body:
Wow what can I say, endoscopy unit at Grimsby was superb. I've had an endoscopy before at Scunthorpe but this was such a superb experience (not saying Scunthorpe wasn't but this just tipped it). Yes I had it cancelled a few times but the department made up for that in spades. Greated by a very nice nurse who immediately put me at ease seeingss though I was a bit apprehensive on having the procedure. Went professional through everything, explaining what will happen, the pros and cons of having the procedure and what problems may or may not occur. Had all my stats taken and was taken to a lovely waiting area. Taken into the procedure and greated by the doctor and nurse who fully explained what they were doing and explained on screen where they were and why they were doing. Constantly asked how I was and reassured if I felt a bit worried. 
I thanked the doctor and nurse for the everything in the procedure as I thought it was done with professionalism and then I was moved into the recovery area. 
Nurses were great throughout the day, professional and courteous and couldn't do enough for you even with it being on a Sunday. One nurse (sorry I don't remember the name) was so happy within her work she made me smile. So many dark clouds and so many bad reviews about hospitals that I needed to express how superb the whole time was when in the department. 
Well done to the endoscopy department in Grimsby, thank you for the whole experience seeing as though it's not the greatest thing to go through. 
5 stars.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: Disgraceful
body: I've heard it was a decent practice until not long time ago, but after merging with others and becoming part of a larger group, it became atrocious. You simply can't book an appointment, which is the only reason one would need a GP practice. I am surprised the NHS is not really looking into how this practice is ran.

title: Cannot make appointments
body:
Tried to get a non-routine appointment. Called at 7.57am when the practice was closed. Then again at 8am when I followed 5 minutes of automated messaging to be told that there were too many people on the queue and got hanged up. Finally at 8.15am just to be told that there were no more appointments.
In my previous GP, we could book appointments online, both for in a fortnight and for the day. Your online platform doesn't work. I don't know why you insist in such an old fashioned practice that waste both patients and your own staff's time.

title: Shocking Service
body: Have tried several mornings (between 8-9am) to get an appointment for the same day each time have had to let the call go, to go to work on hold for over 50mins each time

title: Two appointments cancelled for no reason
body:
My baby has been scheduled for immunisation on 31 january. While we were waiting at Pontoon Dock, the receptionist called us and told us that the appointment was cancelled because the baby was "too young". This made no sense because she was 9 weeks old and the appointment had been arranged by a doctor. They arranged for another appointment on 20/02.
Today 20/02 they cancelled again for "unforeseen circumstances". We received the SMS while on our way to the practice. They didn't even bother to call. I received a message from the NHS that my baby is now overdue vaccination.

title: Can never get an appointment
body: This is my 3rd day taking off work to try get an appointment, 87 redials, as engaged, then get to wait for your contact person, then get cut off. When called back no appointment left, this is at 8.30am in the morning.  Have been advised my Cholesterol is very high, got blood tests over 3 weeks ago, when called to check reception said they were fine, asked her to look at the rest of the medical records and then sad yes you do need an appointment, but can never get one. Terrible pratice.

title: Poor prescription service
body:
I've had my repeat prescription for around 20 years at 3 month at a time, I orderd it last Wednesday as normal to collect it sat 18th Feb to only then realise the 'prescription service' has now changed it to a 28 days prescription without any consultation with myself from anyone or in any way. 
I called the doctor at 8am this morning to redial 324 times, when I get to the surgery their phone isn't even ringing and its because the line is actually busy so there's 1 phone line for all surgery's.
Im now waiting for a call from the 'prescription service' to try and sort my repeat prescription which I was never consalted about the change

title: Awful
body:
As everyone else says an awful practice. But by the look of it they don't care as no reviews replied to. What is the point of the review system if nothing is done to improve it?
When you can get an appointment who you see is usually helpful (not always) The Reception staff however are unhelpful and most of the time rude. I have been hung up on several times. I was told an appointment I made was pointless as they couldnt help me.
